messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: On October 2, DET. C. D. Thompson was dispatched following a disturbance at Pineview Apartments. Principal informants were Mr. Hughes, the building manager, and Ms. Anderson, a tenant. FORWARD COPY TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION. INFORMANT DOCS. Lt. E. F. Gordon - OPERATIONS Det. Thompson, Sr. .. INVESTIGATIONS. Detective G. H. Walker and Detective I. J. Kelly arrived to mediate the situation. COLLINS 14:25 Disturbance Mr. Hughes reported a loud altercation, and Ms. Anderson described an unfamiliar visitor causing chaos. Statement. Technician Sarah recorded witness accounts. CONTINUED FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Thompson Sr, Det. Walker, Det. Kelly OPERATIONS Lt. Gordon INFORMANT Anderson, Lydia 55 Cedar Street, Pineview, Oregon 186-785. 93880. COLLINS 14:25 Disturbance By 3:55 PM, Detectives Thompson, Walker, and Kelly, guided by Lieutenant Gordon, identified the visitor from security footage. Captain K. L. Mitchell deployed additional units. Sergeant M. N. Roberts and Sergeant O. P. Smith ensured residents' safety. By 5:20 PM, the visitor was escorted off the premises with a warning. FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Thompson Sr, Det. Walker, Det. Kelly OPERATIONS Lt. Gordon AFFIDAVIT - Disturbance Report 1) Building Logs 2) Witness Statements 3) F.I.R. 4) Security Tapes 5) Tenant Records (6) Other Details LINE UP INFO ASSISTANT CHIEF DEPUTY IN CHARGE F. Johnson P.A.P.D. 27.105 P64 2975 Hughes, ALAN NAME: ADDRESS: TELEPHONE: 165-3275 DETECTIVE: C. THOMPSON ITEM: 64-5300- 104 CRIME: 14:25 IDENTIFICATION NUMBER 83735 - CONFIRMED Jane Doe DATE 4/20/24 FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION CONTINUED.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: DET. C. D. Thompson  Officer Context: On October 2, DET. C. D. Thompson was dispatched following a disturbance at Pineview Apartments. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Lt. E. F. Gordon  Officer Context: Lt. E. F. Gordon - OPERATIONS Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Detective G. H. Walker  Officer Context: Detective G. H. Walker and Detective I. J. Kelly arrived to mediate the situation. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective I. J. Kelly  Officer Context: Detective G. H. Walker and Detective I. J. Kelly arrived to mediate the situation. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Technician Sarah  Officer Context: Statement. Technician Sarah recorded witness accounts. Officer Role: Technician (from the Crime Lab) Officer Name: Detective Thompson  Officer Context: By 3:55 PM, Detectives Thompson, Walker, and Kelly, guided by Lieutenant Gordon, identified the visitor from security footage. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Walker  Officer Context: By 3:55 PM, Detectives Thompson, Walker, and Kelly, guided by Lieutenant Gordon, identified the visitor from security footage. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Kelly  Officer Context: By 3:55 PM, Detectives Thompson, Walker, and Kelly, guided by Lieutenant Gordon, identified the visitor from security footage. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Captain K. L. Mitchell  Officer Context: Captain K. L. Mitchell deployed additional units. Officer Role: Captain Officer Name: Sergeant M. N. Roberts  Officer Context: Sergeant M. N. Roberts and Sergeant O. P. Smith ensured residents' safety. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sergeant O. P. Smith Officer Context: Sergeant M. N. Roberts and Sergeant O. P. Smith ensured residents' safety. Officer Role: Sergeant
